hero.heading: Durability & Impact
hero.copy: From hurricane debris to the decibels of a passing airplane, there are ways to measure what can get through your door.
hero.direction: Here are some things to consider when you shop

inspiration.heading: Impact resistance
copy: Depending on your building code, you may be required to have impact-resistant glass. This type of glass has a layer of polymer between the glass that can withstand wind, water and debris. Plus, it won’t shatter if it breaks.

inspiration.heading: Noise reduction
copy: The number of panes, types of coating and layers of insulation all factor into how much noise can travel through your door. A door’s Sound Transmission Class (STC) rating will tell you how many decibels make it through the threshold.

next.heading: Now let’s take a look at your safety and privacy options.
next.copy: From dead bolts to smart home sensors, you don’t ever have to second guess your patio door’s security.
